item.title: 新闻集团季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受数字房地产服务、图书出版和道琼斯业务增长的推动，新闻集团周四公布的第一季度营收和利润均超出预期。【原文：News Corp beat estimates for first-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, driven by growth at the digital real estate services, book publishing and Dow Jones segments.】

item.title: 布洛克公司因弹性支出而实现季度盈利
item.description: 周四，支付公司布洛克（Block）公布了第三季度利润报告，原因是经济稳定鼓励客户增加消费。【原文：Payments firm Block reported a third-quarter profit on Thursday as economic stability encouraged customers to ramp up their spending.】

item.title: 卡普里公司因需求不振，季度收入降幅大于预期
item.description: 受各品牌执行失误和全球奢侈品需求放缓的影响，Versace 母公司卡普里控股公司（Capri Holdings）周四公布的季度收入降幅大于预期，导致其股价在盘后交易中下跌 5%。【原文：Versace-parent Capri Holdings posted a bigger-than-expected drop in quarterly revenue on Thursday, hurt by execution missteps across brands and a global slowdown in luxury goods demand, sending its shares down 5% in extended trading.】

item.title: Rivian 季度收入自上市以来首次下滑
item.description: 周四，Rivian 公布了自这家电动汽车制造商三年前上市以来的首次季度收入下降。【原文：Rivian posted its first drop in quarterly revenue on Thursday since the electric vehicle maker went public three years ago.】

item.title: Lucid 收入超出预期，重申年产量
item.description: 由于豪华电动轿车需求强劲，Lucid 周四公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期，并重申了全年产量预期。【原文：Lucid beat Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue on Thursday and reiterated its annual production forecast as it benefits from strong demand for its luxury electric sedans.】

item.title: Pinterest 的营收预期令期待假日季广告提振的投资者失望
item.description: Pinterest 的第四季度营收预期未能打动希望从假日购物季中获得提振的投资者，而此时大型在线广告销售商的表现大多优于市场预期，这使得该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌了 14%。【原文：Pinterest's fourth-quarter revenue forecast failed to impress investors looking for a boost from the holiday shopping season, at a time when bigger online ad sellers largely outperformed, sending the company shares down 14% in extended trading.】

item.title: 国际市场增长强劲，Airbnb 营收窄幅增长
item.description: 受亚太和拉美市场强劲增长的帮助，度假屋租赁公司 Airbnb 周四第三季度营收略微超出预期，在盘后交易中股价震荡飙升，最高涨幅达 15%。【原文：Vacation home rental company Airbnb narrowly beat estimates for third-quarter revenue on Thursday, helped by strong growth in its Asia-Pacific and Latin American markets, sending its shares soaring as much as 15% in volatile after-hours trading.】

item.title: 独家报道华盛顿在特朗普上任前为电池回收商 Li-Cycle 提供 4.75 亿美元贷款
item.description: 美国能源部周四敲定向锂循环控股公司（Li-Cycle Holdings）提供 4.75 亿美元贷款，为这家金属回收商提供资金支持，帮助其在纽约建设电池加工厂，该厂被视为即将离任的美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）建立国内电动汽车供应链愿景的关键。【原文：The U.S. Department of Energy on Thursday finalized a $475 million loan for Li-Cycle Holdings , giving the metals recycler a financial lifeline to build a New York battery processing facility seen as key to outgoing President Joe Biden's vision for a domestic electric vehicle supply chain.】

item.title: 竞争加剧，澳新银行年度利润不及预期
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团周五公布的年度收益低于预期，原因是激烈的存贷款竞争和成本上升影响了其利润率。【原文：Australian lender ANZ Group reported lower-than-expected annual earnings on Friday as intense deposit and lending competition and rising costs impacted its margins.】

item.title: 大多数海湾国家央行效仿美联储，下调主要利率
item.description: 继美联储决定将美国利率下调四分之一个百分点之后，海湾合作委员会（GCC）的大多数中央银行周四都下调了主要利率。【原文：Most central banks of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) cut key interest rates on Thursday, following the Federal Reserve's decision to reduce U.S. rates by a quarter of a percentage point.】

item.title: 美国利率期货预计美联储将在 12 月和 2025 年采取更多宽松政策
item.description: 周四，衡量银行间无担保隔夜贷款成本的联邦基金利率期货定价为下月再降息 25 个基点，此前美联储在为期两天的政策会议结束时也下调了同样幅度的利率。【原文：Futures on the federal funds rate, which measure the cost of unsecured overnight loans between banks, priced in on Thursday another 25-basis-point rate cut next month, after the Federal Reserve lowered rates by the same magnitude at the end of its two-day policy meeting.】

item.title: 澳大利亚电信监管机构因紧急服务中断对 Optus 罚款 800 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚电信监管部门周五早些时候表示，由于 Optus 在去年的一次全国性故障中未能向数千人提供紧急呼叫服务，该监管部门已对 Optus 处以 1200 万澳元（799 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Australian telecom watchdog has fined Optus A$12 million ($7.99 million) for failing to provide emergency call services to thousands during a nationwide outage last year, the regulator said early on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称大选结果不会对近期政策产生影响
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，目前，央行在决策选择中不会考虑本周大选的结果。【原文：Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said that for now, the central bank is not taking on board in its policy-making choices the outcome of this week's election.】

item.title: 高盛任命 95 名新合伙人，其中包括 26 名女性
item.description: 华尔街巨头高盛（Goldman Sachs）周四表示，该公司晋升了 95 名银行家为其精英合伙人，其中包括 26 名女性。【原文：Goldman Sachs promoted 95 bankers to its elite partner ranks, including 26 women, the Wall Street giant said on Thursday.】

item.title: 通用汽车停止生产凯迪拉克 XT4 SUV，转向电动汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周四表示，随着堪萨斯工厂将生产重心转向电动汽车，该公司将于今年 1 月停止生产汽油驱动的凯迪拉克 XT4。【原文：General Motors said on Thursday it will end production of the gas-powered Cadillac XT4 in January as it shifts production at its Kansas plant to electric vehicles.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储如期降息 25 个基点
item.description: 美联储周四将利率下调了四分之一个百分点，原因是决策者们注意到就业市场 "总体趋于宽松"，同时通胀率继续向美国中央银行 2% 的目标迈进。【原文：The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Thursday as policymakers took note of a job market that has "generally eased" while inflation continues to move towards the U.S. central bank's 2% target.】

item.title: 世界黄金协会称今年迄今为止黄金ETF需求转好
item.description: 世界黄金协会（WGC）周四表示，10月份全球实物支持黄金交易所交易基金（ETF）连续第六个月出现资金流入，今年以来首次转为正流入。【原文：Global physically-backed gold exchange-traded funds (ETFs) saw inflows for the sixth straight month in October, with year-to-date flows turning positive for the first time this year, the World Gold Council (WGC) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 瑞士部长称，特朗普获胜后，英国和瑞士将关注美国的银行规则
item.description: 瑞士财政部长卡琳-凯勒-萨特（Karin Keller-Sutter）表示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）本周赢得总统大选后，她已于周四与英国财政部长雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）讨论了美国银行业监管的前景。【原文：Swiss Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter said she had on Thursday discussed the outlook for banking regulation in the United States with her British counterpart Rachel Reeves following Donald Trump's presidential election win this week.】

item.title: 据 CNN 报道，特朗普可能允许美联储主席鲍威尔完成剩余任期
item.description: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）周四援引特朗普的一位高级顾问的话报道称，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普很可能允许杰罗姆-鲍威尔继续担任美联储主席的剩余任期。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is likely to allow Jerome Powell to serve the remainder of his term as the Federal Reserve chair, CNN reported on Thursday, citing a senior adviser to Trump.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款升至 6.79% 的四个月新高
item.description: 由于担心当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提出的经济政策会刺激通货膨胀，美国抵押贷款利率本周升至四个月来的最高点，并可能进一步上升。【原文：U.S. mortgage rates increased to a four-month high this week and could rise further amid fears that President-elect Donald Trump's proposed economic policies could stoke inflation.】

item.title: 倍耐力第三季度运营利润增幅高于预期
item.description: 意大利轮胎制造商倍耐力（Pirelli）周四表示，得益于销量、产品组合和效率的增长，其第三季度营业利润增幅超过预期。【原文：Italian tyre maker Pirelli said on Thursday its operating profit rose more than expected in the third quarter, thanks to growing volumes, product mix and efficiencies.】

item.title: 特朗普不太可能实施全面关税计划 - 标普全球
item.description: 评级机构S&P Global周四在一份报告中称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺对进口商品普遍征收10%的关税，对中国商品征收60%的关税，这很可能只是谈判的一个起点。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's pledge to impose a universal 10% tariff on imports and 60% on Chinese goods is likely only a starting point for negotiations, ratings agency S&P Global said in a note on Thursday.】

item.title: 先锋公司将向被巨额税单困扰的共同基金投资者支付 4000 万美元
item.description: 美国最大的共同基金资产管理公司先锋集团（Vanguard Group）同意支付 4000 万美元，以了结一项诉讼，该诉讼称先锋集团让其广受欢迎的目标日期退休基金的普通投资者承担了出人意料的巨额税费。【原文：Vanguard Group, the largest U.S. manager of mutual fund assets, agreed to pay $40 million to settle a lawsuit claiming it stuck ordinary investors in its popular target-date retirement funds with surprisingly large tax bills.】

item.title: 因担心特朗普征收关税，斯蒂芬-麦登将削减中国采购量
item.description: 史蒂文-麦登公司高管周四表示，在唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选后，公司正在迅速将产品采购从中国转移到其他国家。【原文：Steven Madden executives said on Thursday the company was working quickly to shift product sourcing out of China to other countries after Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election victory.】

item.title: 美国大选欣喜消退，特朗普媒体股价下滑
item.description: 特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）股价周四跌至两周低点，因为对唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选的投机性押注在他获胜一天后失去了动力。【原文：Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group slumped to a two-week low on Thursday, as speculative bets on Donald Trump winning the U.S. presidential election lost steam a day after his victory.】

item.title: 美国蜂窝将以 10 亿美元向 AT&T 出售部分频谱许可
item.description: 美国蜂窝公司（United States Cellular）周四表示，已同意将用于传输移动电话信号和高速数据服务的部分频谱许可出售给 AT&T，交易金额为 10.2 亿美元。【原文：United States Cellular said on Thursday it has agreed to sell a portion of spectrum licenses used to transmit mobile phone signals and high-speed data services to AT&T in a $1.02 billion deal.】

item.title: 宾利将于 2026 年推出 SUV 电动车，并将插电式混合动力车的销售期延长至 2035 年
item.description: 英国豪华汽车制造商宾利周四表示，将于2026年推出首款电动汽车，并表示将继续销售插电式混合动力汽车直至2035年，正式放弃了此前提出的到2030年实现完全电动化的目标。【原文：British luxury carmaker Bentley said on Thursday it will launch its first electric car in 2026 and said it will keep selling plug-in hybrids until 2035, formally abandoning a previous goal of going fully electric by 2030.】

item.title: 波音准备恢复 737 生产，FAA 将加强监管
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周四表示，在本周早些时候结束的为期53天的罢工之后，波音公司准备恢复737 MAX的生产，美国联邦航空管理局将加强监督。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said Thursday it will boost oversight as Boeing prepares to resume 737 MAX production following a 53-day strike that ended earlier this week.】

item.title: 美国 9 月份批发库存修正后有所下降
item.description: 由于机动车库存大幅下降，9 月份美国批发库存的降幅超过了最初的预期。【原文：U.S. wholesale inventories fell more than initially thought in September amid a sharp decline in motor vehicle stocks.】

item.title: 美国银行将从特朗普宽松的资本和兼并政策中获益
item.description: 业内专家和分析师表示，随着前总统唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，银行业有望大获全胜，共和党监管机构有望放宽资本规则和兼并审批。【原文：The banking industry is expected to win big as former President Donald Trump returns to the White House, ushering in Republican regulators who are expected to ease capital rules and merger approvals, industry experts and analysts said.】
